New Records: New Zealand scored 200 runs in 17.1 overs, their highest score in a T20I match against Australia.
Australia scored only 111 runs in their innings, their lowest score in a T20I match since 2010.
Mitchell Starc became the first Australia player to take the wicket of Pat Cummins in a T20I match.
Key Match Events: Trent Boult took a hat-trick, dismissing Adam Zampa and Mitchell Starc in quick succession.
Devon Conway scored 92 off 58 balls, the second-highest score by a New Zealand batter in T20I history.
Mitchell Starc, despite being dismissed, contributed to Australia's total with 26 runs.
Post-Match Reflections: Commentators noted Australia's poor performance and the need for improvement ahead of their next match.
The win marked New Zealand's first significant victory in a World Cup opener since 2007.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was significant for New Zealand's World Cup campaign as it set the tone for their performance.
Defending champions Australia's heavy loss was a major setback.
